snippet: In Brooklyn, theft prevention has changed just about everything involved in the transaction of buying a pair of sneakers — even the simple act of trying them on for size.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column examines escalating game of cat-and-mouse between managers of sneaker stores in Brooklyn and thieves who are finding increasingly creative ways to steal shoes, even if it is one sneaker at a time; recounts interview with manager of a Foot Locker, which included a visit to a room lined with shelves holding only left-foot sneakers.
lead_paragraph: In Brooklyn, theft prevention has changed just about everything involved in the transaction of buying a pair of sneakers — even the simple act of trying them on for size.

headline.print_headline: Trying On, Selling and Stealing Sneakers, One Shoe at a Time
